intro: Uncarina leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of the Caribbean and northern South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are often pink or white. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Uncarina leptocarpa thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in maritime environments.
